thread.title: Wayne Rooney to Arsenal transfer news: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney is worth a gamble for leaderless Arsenal, says Harry Redknapp | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Wayne Rooney to Arsenal transfer news: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney is worth a gamble for leaderless Arsenal, says Harry Redknapp | London Evening Standard

author: Harry Redknapp
title: Wayne Rooney to Arsenal transfer news: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney is worth a gamble for leaderless Arsenal, says Harry Redknapp | London Evening Standard
text:
Wayne Rooney's 14 goals against Arsenal 1/14 DATE: October 19, 2002 
Wayne Rooney opens his Premier League account with a last-gasp winner for Everton against Arsenal to announce himself to the world. He was just 16 years old. Getty Images 2/14 DATE: March 23, 2003 
Wayne Rooney made it two goals in as many appearances against Arsenal with a fine solo effort, running at Pascal Cygan before firing a shot between the defender's legs and past Stuart Taylor. 3/14 DATE: October 24, 2004 
Now at Manchester United, Wayne Rooney helped end Arsenal's long unbeaten run at 49 games with a late goal in a 2-0 win. Man Utd via Getty Images 4/14 DATE: April 9, 2006 
Wayne Rooney opened the scoring in a 2-0 win for Manchester United, leaving Arsenal at risk of missing out of the Champions League. Man Utd via Getty Images 5/14 DATE: January 21, 2007 
Wayne Rooney opened the scoring but could only watch as Robin van Persie and Thierry Henry scored two goals in the final seven minutes to secure a 2-1 win over Arsenal. Man Utd via Getty Images 6/14 DATE: February 16, 2008 
Wayne Rooney again opened the scoring against Arsenal, though this time on the way to a 4-0 win for Manchester United in the FA Cup. Man Utd via Getty Images 7/14 DATE: August 29, 2009 
Wayne Rooney scored from the spot as Manchester United came from behind to beat Arsenal. with Abou Diaby's own goal settling a 2-1 win. Man Utd via Getty Images 8/14 DATE: January 31, 2010 
Wayne Rooney added to an earlier Manuel Almunia own goal as Manchester United went on to win 3-1 at the Emirates Stadium as again Arsenal were outclassed. Man Utd via Getty Images 9/14 DATE: March 12, 2011 
Wayne Rooney wrapped up a 2-0 win as Manchester United knocked Arsenal out of the FA Cup, their third competition elimination within two weeks. Getty Images 10/14 DATE: August 28, 2011 
The first of three for Wayne Rooney, this one a free kick, as Manchester United humiliated Arsenal with a 8-2 victory. Man Utd via Getty Images 11/14 DATE: August 28, 2011 
A second goal of the game and a second free kick for Wayne Rooney on the day. Man Utd via Getty Images 12/14 DATE: August 28, 2011 
Wayne Rooney completed his hat-trick from the penalty spot. Man Utd via Getty Images 13/14 DATE: November 22, 2014 
Wayne Rooney secured Louis van Gaal's first away win as Manchester United in a hard-fought 2-1 victory at the Emirates Stadium. Getty Images 14/14 DATE: March 9, 2015 
Wayne Rooney quickly cancelled out Nacho Monreal's opener for Arsenal but Manchester United had Angel Di Maria sent off on the way to a 2-1 loss in the FA Cup thanks to Danny Welbeck's winner. Man Utd via Getty Images 
Arsenal should take a gamble and sign Wayne Rooney on a two-year contract. There’s no love lost between Jose Mourinho and Arsene Wenger but Petr Cech moved between the two managers and Wayne deserves the chance to choose his next move. 
It is pretty clear his time at Manchester United is coming to an end. Jose is saying all the right things publicly but his team selections make it obvious he doesn’t fancy him and that’s his choice as manager. 
Wayne isn’t going to be happy going into Carrington on a Monday morning with all the players who were involved in a win the weekend before, buzzing and flying about their performance while he’s sitting there not being a part of it. 
He’s obviously a big player at the club but if you aren’t in the team, you are one step removed from all that and he won’t stand for it. 
Wayne always wants to play and that’s what made him great. He was a street footballer with the same hunger and desire as a kid in the playground. 
It’ll be killing him to sit around as part of a squad, even if he has broken Sir Bobby Charlton’s goalscoring record. (Man Utd via Getty Images) 
There’s a lot of talk about Rooney going to China but I can’t see that happening, at least not before Tuesday’s transfer window deadline. 
Everything would have to be 100 per cent right and even though he has got Paul Stretford behind him – a very experienced guy and top football agent – it is a very long process to get a deal of that size over the line. Tianjin Quanjian boss confirms Rooney interest after failed Costa bid 
I suppose they could have been working on a deal for a while which would help but it makes more sense to keep his options open until the summer. And if Rooney is available then, the Gunners should come in for him. 
Arsenal looked at him a few years ago so we know Arsene is a fan. He would improve that team overnight because they have an issue with attitude and he is a winner. 
I watched Arsenal the other night at Sutton and I know it was a difficult pitch but some of their younger players were getting caught in possession, losing it cheaply and were putting their team in danger. In Pictures | Sutton United vs Arsenal | 20/02/2017 In Pictures | Sutton United vs Arsenal | 20/02/2017 1/50
